t: Amos 5
Hear*p ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
The*p virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
For*p thus saith the Lord God;*s The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.
For*p thus saith the Lord*s unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
But*p seek not Beth–el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer–sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth–el shall come to nought.
Seek*p the Lord,*s and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth–el.
Ye*p who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

Seek*p him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord*s is his name:
That*p strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
They*p hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

Forasmuch*p therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.
For*p I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
Therefore*p the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
Seek*p good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the Lord,*s the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
Hate*p the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the Lord*s God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore*p the Lord,*s the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
And*p in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the Lord.*s
Woe*p unto you that desire the day of the Lord!*s to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord*s is darkness, and not light.
As*p if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
Shall*p not the day of the Lord*s be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
I*p hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
Though*p ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
Take*p thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
But*p let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
Have*p ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
But*p ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
Therefore*p will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord,*s whose name is The God of hosts.
